thread.title: Philip Glass on New York’s Starving-Artist Culture, His Father’s Record Store and Tibet

author: Charles Passy
title: Philip Glass on New York’s Starving-Artist Culture, His Father’s Record Store and Tibet
text:
At 81, Philip Glass could be called one of the elders of contemporary American music.
The Baltimore-born, New York-based composer rose to prominence more than 40 years ago as a pioneer of the repetitive style often dubbed minimalism. His groundbreaking, avant-garde opera “Einstein on the Beach” has now been seen in countless productions around the world.
Today,... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
